summary.long: 2 Peter is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: Simon Peter, a servant and an apostle of Jesus Christ, To those who have obtained like precious faith with us through the righteousness of God and our Savior Jesus Christ:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Grace and peace be multiplied unto you through the knowledge of God and of Jesus our Lord, according as
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His divine power hath given unto us all things that pertain unto life and godliness, through the knowledge of Him that hath called us to glory and virtue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thereby are given unto us exceeding great and precious promises, that by these you might be partakers of the divine nature, having escaped the corruption that is in the world through lust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And besides this, using all diligence, add to your faith virtue, and to virtue knowledge,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to knowledge temperance, and to temperance patience, and to patience godliness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to godliness brotherly kindness, and to brotherly kindness charity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if these things be in you and abound, they make you that ye shall be neither barren nor unfruitful in the knowledge of our Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he that lacketh these things is blind and cannot see afar off, and hath forgotten that he was purged from his old sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore brethren, give diligence all the more to make your calling and election sure, for if ye do these things ye shall never fall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For so an entrance shall be ministered unto you abundantly into the everlasting Kingdom of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore I will not be negligent to put you always in remembrance of these things, though ye know them and are strengthened in the present truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yea, I think it meet, as long as I am in this tabernacle, to stir you up by putting you in remembrance,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: knowing that shortly I must put off this my tabernacle, even as our Lord Jesus Christ hath shown me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover I will endeavor that you may be able after my decease to have these things always in remembrance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we have not followed cunningly devised fables when we made known unto you the power and coming of our Lord Jesus Christ, but were eyewitnesses of His majesty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For He received from God the Father honor and glory when there came such a voice to Him from the Excellent Glory: “This is My beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this voice, which came from Heaven, we heard when we were with Him on the holy mount.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We have also a more sure word of prophecy, unto which ye do well that ye take heed, as unto a light that shineth in a dark place, until the day dawn and the day star arise in your hearts,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: knowing this first: that no prophecy of the Scripture is of any private interpretation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the prophecy came not in olden times by the will of man, but holy men of God spoke as they were moved by the Holy Ghost.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But there were false prophets also among the people, even as there shall be false teachers among you, who privily shall bring in damnable heresies, even denying the Lord who bought them, and bring upon themselves swift destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And many shall follow their pernicious ways, by reason of whom the way of truth shall be evilly spoken of.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And through covetousness shall they with feigned words make merchandise of you — they whose judgment now for a long time lingereth not, and their damnation slumbereth not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if God spared not the angels who sinned, but cast them down to hell and delivered them into chains of darkness to be reserved unto judgment;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and spared not the old world, but saved Noah, the eighth person, a preacher of righteousness, bringing in the Flood upon the world of the ungodly;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and, turning the cities of Sodom and Gomorrah into ashes, condemned them to be overthrown, making them an example unto those who thereafter should live ungodly;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if He delivered righteous Lot, vexed with the filthy conduct of the wicked
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (for that righteous man, having dwelt among them seeing and hearing, was vexed in his righteous soul day after day with their unlawful deeds)—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then the Lord knoweth how to deliver the godly out of temptations and to reserve the unjust unto the Day of Judgment to be punished,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but chiefly those who walk after the flesh in the lust of uncleanness, and despise governance. Presumptuous are they and selfwilled; they are not afraid to speak evil of dignities,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whereas angels, which are greater in power and might, bring not railing accusation against them before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But these, as natural brute beasts, made to be taken and destroyed, speak evil of the things that they understand not, and shall utterly perish in their own corruption,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and shall receive the reward of unrighteousness, as those who count it pleasure to revel in the daytime. Spots they are and blemishes, sporting themselves with their own deceptions while they feast with you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: having eyes full of adultery and who cannot cease from sin, beguiling unstable souls; their hearts they have exercised with covetous practices; accursed children!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They have forsaken the right way and have gone astray, following the way of Balaam the son of Beor, who loved the wages ofunrighteousness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but was rebuked for his iniquity: the dumb ass speaking with a man’s voice forbad the madness of the prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are wells without water, clouds that are carried by a tempest, for whom the mist of darkness is reserved for ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For when they speak great swelling words of vanity, they allure through the lusts of the flesh and through much wantonness those who had clean escaped from those who live in error.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While they promise them liberty, they themselves are the servants of corruption; for by whom a man is overcome, by the same is he brought into bondage.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if, after they have escaped the pollutions of the world through the knowledge of the Lord and Savior Jesus Christ, they are again entangled therein and overcome, the latter end is worse with them than the beginning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it would have been better for them not to have known the way of righteousness, than, after they had known it, to turn from the holy commandment delivered unto them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But it has happened unto them according to the true proverb: “The dog turns to his own vomit again,” and, “the sow that was washed, to her wallowing in the mire.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This second epistle, beloved, I now write unto you, in both of which I stir up your purity of mind by way of remembrance,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that ye may be mindful of the words which were spoken beforehand by the holy prophets and of the commandment of us, the apostles of the Lord and Savior,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: knowing this first: that there shall come in the last days scoffers, walking after their own lusts
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and saying, “Where is the promise of His coming? For since the fathers fell asleep, all things continue as they were from the beginning of the creation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For of this they are willfully ignorant: that by the Word of God the heavens were of old, and the earth standing out of the water and in the water,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whereby the world as it then was, being overflowed with water, perished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the heavens and the earth which now are, by the same Word are kept in store, reserved unto fire against the Day of Judgment and perdition of ungodly men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But, beloved, be not ignorant of this one thing: that with the Lord one day is as a thousand years, and a thousand years as one day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord is not slack concerning His promise, as some men count slackness, but is longsuffering toward us, not willing that any should perish, but that all should come to repentance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Day of the Lord will come as a thief in the night, in which the heavens shall pass away with a great noise, and the elements shall melt with fervent heat. The earth also and the works that are therein shall be burned up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seeing then that all these things shall be dissolved, what manner of persons ought ye to be in all holy manner of living and godliness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: looking for and hastening unto the coming of the Day of God, wherein the heavens, being on fire, shall be dissolved and the elements shall melt with fervent heat?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless we, according to His promise, look for new heavens and a new earth, wherein dwelleth righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, beloved, seeing that ye look for such things, be diligent that ye may be found by Him in peace, without spot and blameless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And account that the longsuffering of our Lord is salvation, even as our beloved brother Paul also, according to the wisdom given unto him, hath written unto you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as also in all his epistles, speaking in them of these things. Therein are some things hard to understand, which those who are unlearned and unstable wrest, as they do also the other Scriptures, unto their own destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye therefore, beloved, seeing that ye know these things beforehand, beware lest ye also, being led away with the error of the wicked, fall from your own steadfastness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But grow in grace and in the knowledge of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ. To Him be glory both now and for ever. Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator
